column4: sh*t that unofficial starter guide has a gapping hole.  No printer instructions for the newbie, however it is with gnome-cups-manager
system->administration->printers add new printer
I know that
pick local, detected printer, model, and set it to do letter instead of A4 in the printer properties.
but do you know how to add a printer without gnome?
localhost:631 but that's disabled in ubuntu.
as last time I checked the web interface was disabled
yes
kde should have a printer manager in the system configuration
so I'll have to apt-get install gnome-cups-manager onto my minimal install
thanks
how are you without gnome?  Kshutubuntu?
oh
you have a minimal install
hmm.
I just want to use xfce4
ask how to enable the web interface in some channel, heh techii may know how.
I hardly use any gnome specific features,
/etc/cups ? will do
#gentoo may know how to reconfigure cups to allow web interface on 127.0.0.1 (yes lots of non-gentoo questions get asked there)
thanks guys
or #cups
